GSC COIN PEER CONNECTION TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE
==============================================

PROBLEM IDENTIFIED:
Two devices running gscvags.exe cannot connect to each other and don't show connected peers.

ROOT CAUSES FIXED:
1. âœ… Seed nodes were localhost IPs (won't work across devices)
2. âœ… No IP address display in GUI for manual connection
3. âœ… Improved peer discovery system
4. âœ… Enhanced network address detection

SOLUTION - USE gscvags_fixed.exe:
================================

The new gscvags_fixed.exe includes:
âœ… Better IP address detection
âœ… Network address display in GUI
âœ… Improved peer connectivity
âœ… Manual connection capabilities
âœ… Real-time network status

HOW TO CONNECT TWO DEVICES:
===========================

STEP 1: Get Your Network Information
-----------------------------------
1. Run gscvags_fixed.exe on Device A
2. Go to "Network" tab
3. Look for "Connection Information" section
4. Note your IP Address (e.g., 192.168.1.100)
5. Note your P2P Address (e.g., 192.168.1.100:8333)

STEP 2: Share Your P2P Address
-----------------------------
1. Copy your P2P Address using the "Copy" button
2. Share it with the other device user
   - Via text message, email, or verbally
   - Example: "My P2P Address is 192.168.1.100:8333"

STEP 3: Connect Manually
-----------------------
On Device B:
1. Run gscvags_fixed.exe
2. Go to "Network" tab
3. Find "Manual Connect" section
4. Enter Device A's IP address: 192.168.1.100
5. Enter Port: 8333
6. Click "Connect to Peer"

STEP 4: Verify Connection
------------------------
Both devices should now show:
- Connected Peers: 1 (or more)
- Network Status: ðŸŸ¢ Connected
- Peer listed in "Connected Peers" section

TROUBLESHOOTING:
===============

If connection fails:

1. CHECK NETWORK:
   - Both devices on same WiFi network?
   - Same subnet (192.168.1.x or 192.168.0.x)?

2. CHECK FIREWALL:
   - Windows Firewall may block port 8333
   - Allow gscvags_fixed.exe through firewall
   - Or temporarily disable firewall for testing

3. CHECK IP ADDRESSES:
   - Use correct IP from "Connection Information"
   - Don't use 127.0.0.1 (localhost only)
   - Use actual network IP (192.168.x.x)

4. CHECK PORT:
   - Default P2P port is 8333
   - Make sure port is not used by other apps

5. RESTART IF NEEDED:
   - Close and restart gscvags_fixed.exe
   - Try connecting from both directions

NETWORK REQUIREMENTS:
====================
- Same local network (WiFi/Ethernet)
- Port 8333 available
- Windows Firewall configured
- Valid network IP addresses

RPC CONNECTIVITY:
================
- RPC Server runs on port 8332
- RPC Address shown in Connection Information
- Use for external integrations
- Example: http://192.168.1.100:8332

TESTING TRANSACTION BROADCASTING:
================================
Once connected:
1. Send a transaction on Device A
2. Check mempool on Device B
3. Transaction should appear automatically
4. Start mining on either device
5. Mined block broadcasts to both

ADVANCED TROUBLESHOOTING:
========================

Windows Firewall Fix:
1. Windows Security â†’ Firewall & network protection
2. Allow an app through firewall
3. Add gscvags_fixed.exe to exceptions
4. Allow for both Private and Public networks

Network Discovery:
1. If manual connection fails
2. Try connecting from both directions
3. Check Windows network discovery settings
4. Ensure network profile is "Private" not "Public"

Port Testing:
1. Use telnet to test port connectivity
2. telnet [IP_ADDRESS] 8333
3. Should connect if port is open

WHAT'S FIXED IN gscvags_fixed.exe:
=================================
âœ… Removed non-working seed nodes
âœ… Added network address display in GUI
âœ… Improved IP address detection
âœ… Enhanced peer discovery system
âœ… Better error handling for connections
âœ… Real-time network status updates
âœ… Copy buttons for easy address sharing

SUCCESS INDICATORS:
==================
When working correctly, you'll see:
- ðŸŸ¢ Connected status in Network tab
- Peer count > 0
- Peer IP addresses listed
- Transactions sync between devices
- Blocks broadcast automatically
- Shared mempool across devices

For additional support, check the network logs in the GUI console tab.
